intro: Pelargonium lineare, commonly known as the linear geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, or white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Pelargonium lineare is also valued for its aromatic foliage and ease of care.
